column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – September 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: New report shows progress in sustainable aviation fuel uptake across the EU
column3: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) published its first annual report on the implementation of the ReFuelEU aviation regulation.

column2: Road Safety Statistics for 2024: Progress continues amid persistent challenges
column3: In 2024, 19,940 people lost their lives in road crashes across the EU, according to latest statistics released by the European Commission today.

column2: Young people and transport jobs: making transport careers more attractive
column3: On 15 October 2025, the Commission hosted a conference on 'Young people and transport jobs: making transport careers more attractive' in Brussels.

column2: The new Entry/Exit System went live on 12 October
column3: On 12 October, 29 European countries started introducing Europe’s new digital border system - the Entry/Exit System (EES) at their external borders. European countries started electronically registering the data of non-EU nationals crossing their external borders for short stays.

column2: Statement ahead of the IMO’s Marine Environment Protection Committee (MEPC) meeting
column3: The EU supports ambitious global measures at IMO level with a view to decarbonise the shipping sector, and ensure a global level playing field.

column2: EU and Azerbaijan deepen transport cooperation at second transport dialogue
column3: On 9 October, the European Commission and the Ministry of Digital Development and Transport of Azerbaijan held the second High-Level Transport Dialogue, co-chaired by Minister Rashad Nabiyev and Director-General Magda Kopczyńska.

column2: October infringements package: key decisions
column3: October infringements package: key decisions

column2: New Performance Review Board appointed to drive implementation of the Single European Sky
column3: A new Performance Review Board (PRB) has been appointed to guide the implementation of the Single European Sky initiative.

column2: EU welcomes UN aviation agency’s condemnation of Russia for undermining global aviation safety
column3: The ICAO has formally condemned Russia for repeatedly interfering with Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) signals in Europe.

column2: Commission proposes a targeted amendment of EU rules on road tolls and user charges to clarify and simplify certain provisions
column3: The Commission presented an amended proposal to make certain provisions of the eurovignette directive clearer, simpler and more precise.

column2: Women in rail award 2025: winners announced
column3: The 2025 edition of the women in rail award was held in Kraków, Poland, as part of the European rail safety days.

column2: New call for proposals: mobile application for professional lorry drivers to rate points of interest
column3: The Commission calls for proposals to develop a mobile application where professional lorry drivers can rate their main points of interest on the road, from rest and parking facilities to areas for loading and unloading their cargo.

column2: EU progress on cycling – greener, healthier, more inclusive mobility
column3: The Commission adopted its first progress report on the European declaration on cycling, showing strong momentum across the EU to boost cycling infrastructure and policies. The report confirms cycling’s role as a clean, affordable and health-boosting way to travel.

column2: EU Urban Mobility Days to take place in Vilnius: three days of sharing innovation ideas, best practices, and sustainable mobility solutions
column3: From 30 September to 2 October, EU Urban Mobility Days will take place in Vilnius.

column2: EU and Ukraine extend road transport agreement until 31 March 2027
column3: The EU and Ukraine decided today to extend the validity of their current road transport agreement.

column2: EU and ICAO mark milestone in sustainable aviation fuels project
column3: A special ceremony was held during the 42nd ICAO Assembly, to mark the completion of three EU funded studies under the International Civil Aviation Organization’s capacity building and training programme for sustainable aviation fuels (ACT-SAF).

column2: Reducing cost of high-speed rail constructions
column3: How can we reduce high-speed rail constructions costs along the nine corridors on the trans-European transport network?

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – August 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: EU and ICAO strengthen cooperation ahead of the 42nd ICAO Assembly
column3: The EU and ICAO have reaffirmed their strong commitment to advancing global aviation safety, security and sustainability during the 9th EU-ICAO Joint Committee meeting, held on 22 September at ICAO Headquarters in Montréal.

column2: EU and Moldova extend road transport agreement
column3: The agreement aims at helping Moldova access world markets by facilitating transit through EU countries and further developing its links with the EU market.

column2: Have your say on military mobility challenges
column3: To improve the movement of military troops, equipment and assets across the European Union and beyond, the Commission would like to hear your views on the military mobility package.

column2: European Mobility Week 2025 promotes inclusive and sustainable mobility for everyone
column3: From 16 to 22 September, more than 2,500 towns and cities will celebrate European Mobility Week.

column2: EU Ministers commit to faster truck recharging deployment
column3: Commissioner for Transport and Tourism Apostolos Tzitzikostas presents the Clean Transport Corridor Initiative, which seeks to accelerate the deployment of heavy-duty vehicles recharging infrastructure across key freight corridors.

column2: New coordinators appointed to drive completion of Europe’s trans-European transport network
column3: Three European Coordinators have been designated to help complete the trans-European transport network (TEN-T), a vast infrastructure network of railways, roads, and inland waterways connecting the European Union.

column2: Commission launches new initiatives with industry to boost Europe's Automotive leadership
column3: President Ursula von der Leyen chaired the third Strategic Dialogue on the Future of the European Automotive Industry, bringing together the European automotive industry, social partners, and other stakeholders in Brussels.

column2: Job vacancy (establishment of reserve list) within EU-RAIL for the position of System Pillar Programme Manager (CA FGIV)
column3: The Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL) is establishing a reserve list for a post of System Pillar Programme Manager (Contract Agent, Grade FGIV)

column2: Decarbonising aviation: European Commission supports development of sustainable aviation fuels in Africa
column3: In alignment with the EU Green Deal and the global commitment to achieving net zero emissions in international aviation by 2050, the Commission is fostering the global development and production of sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs) to decarbonise air transport.

column2: New EU-funded railway line brings Ukraine even closer to EU
column3: Ukraine opened its first railway line based on the European Union standard for track width, marking a significant step in deepening the country’s transport integration with the EU.

column2: Commission announces shortlist for the 2026 European Capital & Green Pioneer of Smart Tourism Awards
column3: The European Commission revealed the finalists for the 2026 European Capital and Green Pioneer of Smart Tourism competitions

column2: Commission welcomes Code of Conduct for reliable online reviews for tourism accommodation
column3: Several stakeholders of the EU tourism ecosystem took an important step to ensure trustworthy and reliable online reviews and ratings of hotels and other types of tourism accommodation, by endorsing the ‘Code of Conduct for Online Ratings and Reviews for Tourism Accommodation’.

column2: Boosting tourism and tradition: new call for proposals to promote handicraft products and support craftsmen
column3: The European Commission is offering a special opportunity through a call for proposals aimed at supporting craftsmen across the EU.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – July 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Stronger and more unified  enforcement of EU rules in international road transport as smart tachograph retrofit phase concludes for heavy-duty vehicles
column3: As of today, all heavy-duty vehicles registered in the EU and operating in Member States other than their Member State of registration must be fitted with a smart tachograph (version 2).

column2: Commission takes step to update air service rules
column3: The European Commission is inviting citizens, travellers and stakeholders to express their views via a public consultation on the revision of the Air Services Regulation – the framework governing access to the EU internal market for aviation, and operations within it.

column2: Commission seeks feedback on EU airport rules
column3: The European Commission has today launched a public consultation to assess the effectiveness of three pieces of EU legislation governing access to and the pricing of services at airports. Citizens, professionals and experts alike are invited to give feedback.
The Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL), based in Brussels is establishing a reserve list for a post of communication and ex-post audit officer (temporary agent, grade AD5)

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – June 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: More online travel agencies commit to refund within 14 days for cancelled flights, following a dialogue with the Commission and consumer authorities
column3: Following a dialogue with the European Commission and the Consumer Protection Cooperation Network of national consumer authorities, Expedia and Lastminute.com have committed to better inform consumers of their rights and ensure they receive ticket refunds within 14 days.

column2: Commission publishes new guidance on sustainable rural mobility and ecotourism
column3: Today the Commission publishes four new guidance documents, developed under the SMARTA-NET Project ‘Sustainable rural mobility in support of ecotourism’.

column2: European Commission adopts 9th report on development of the rail market
column3: The ninth Rail Market Monitoring Report (RMMS) analyses developments in the EU rail market from 2018 to 2022.

column2: Portugal signs concession and first tranche of financing for new Lisbon-Porto high-speed line
column3: Backed by €813 million from the Connecting Europe Facility, the Lisbon-Porto high speed railway will shorten travel time between the two cities from approximately 3 hours to 1 hour 15 minutes, once completed.

column2: Commission launches call for evidence on revision to Rail Passenger Rights
column3: The European Commission is requesting input from citizens and stakeholders on a planned targeted revision of the Rail Passenger Rights Regulation.

column2: Sustainable EU tourism: new communication toolkit available
column3: Ready to make tourism in your destination more sustainable? The Sustainable EU Tourism initiative is here to support you.

column2: Commissioner Tzitzikostas hosts dialogues on cutting transport emissions
column3: Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism, Apostolos Tzitzikostas, will host two dialogues to advance the decarbonisation of EU transport.

column2: July infringements package: key decisions
column3: July infringements package: key decisions

column2: The EU Flight Emissions Label takes a flight forward with first airlines committing to the scheme
column3: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) has signed an agreement with Air France-KLM to help the airlines prepare for joining the EU Flight Emissions Label (FEL).

column2: Commission adopts milestones for the completion of Rail Baltica
column3: The European Commission has today adopted an implementing decision setting out key milestones and deadlines for the completion of Rail Baltica, a flagship cross-border railway infrastructure project that will significantly enhance connectivity within the European Union.

column2: Call for applications for the Commission expert group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky
column3: To complement the current memberships of the Commission expert group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky, the Commission has launched a call for applications for new members.

column2: Commission reviews progress toward a Single European Railway Area
column3: The Commission published a report assessing the implementation of the Single European Railway Area Directive, taking an initial position on how its provisions have influenced the development of the European rail sector to date.

column2: EU invests €2.8 billion in 94 transport projects to boost sustainable and connected mobility across Europe
column3: The Commission has selected 94 transport projects to receive nearly €2.8 billion in EU grants under the Connecting Europe Facility.

column2: The Commission sets course for the future of the EU Ports and Maritime Industry
column3: The European Commission has started preparations for an EU Ports Strategy and EU Industrial Maritime Strategy and is inviting stakeholders to participate in the process.

column2: Commissioners Tzitzikostas and Kubilius to discuss necessary investments in EU military mobility and infrastructure
column3: Commissioners Apostolos Tzitzikostas and Andrius Kubilius participate in the extraordinary TEN-T Committee with Member States, aimed at speeding up the EU’s military mobility policy -a cornerstone of Europe's defence and security architecture.

column2: Commission proposes toll exemptions to boost demand for zero-emission lorries and buses
column3: As pledged in its Industrial Action Plan for the European automotive sector, the Commission is proposing to extend the period in which zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles (HDVs) can be exempted from tolls and user charges.

column2: The Commission welcomes provisional agreement on modernising river information services in EU
column3: The Commission welcomes the provisional political agreement to modernise traffic management on the EU’s rivers and canals.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – May 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Have your say on the upcoming EU sustainable tourism strategy
column3: Starting today, citizens are invited to have their say in the Commission’s open public consultation and call for evidence.

column2: New communication assesses market readiness of heavy-duty road transport vehicles
column3: A Commission Communication assesses whether zero emission heavy duty vehicles are entering the market as expected at the time of adopting AFIR and whether the mandatory infrastructure deployment targets for HDV for the year 2030 as stipulated under AFIR are in line with the expected vehicle uptake.

column2: June infringements package: key decisions
column3: June infringements package: key decisions

column2: EU addressing military mobility challenges
column3: To improve the movement of military troops, equipment and assets across the European Union and beyond, the European Commission and the EU's High Representative, have started discussions with stakeholders to develop a Military Mobility Package.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: EU and IOM enhance infrastructure at Ukrainian border crossing points
column3: Representatives from the European Commission, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) and Ukraine’s State Agency for Restoration and Infrastructure Development officially opened a lane for freight vehicles at Luzhanka border crossing point in Zakarpattia region.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: EU-funded scanner boosts throughput at Polish-Ukrainian border
column3: A new EU-funded mobile cargo scanner inaugurated today will increase the capacity for transporting goods through the border crossing point in Krakovets-Korczowa at the Polish-Ukrainian border.

column2: Deadline extended: Apply now for the Women in Rail Award 2025
column3: Individuals, companies and organisations can apply before 17 June 2025 (midnight CEST).

column2: Recommendations to boost women’s participation in the EU transport sector
column3: In an effort to close the gender gap and address staff shortages within the EU transport sector, the Women in Transport – EU Platform for Change has unveiled a set of practical advice aimed at attracting and retaining women in the industry.

column2: Commission updates EU Air Safety List, banning all air carriers certified in Tanzania and Suriname from operating in the EU
column3: The Commission updated the EU Air Safety List, the list of airlines that are subject to an operating ban or operational restrictions within the European Union, because they do not meet international safety standards.

column2: Progress towards a green and digital tourism: Commission publishes stocktaking report
column3: The Commission has published its second report on the progress of actions set out in the Transition Pathway for Tourism – the first and most advanced of the transition pathways.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – April 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Deadline extended: Call for applications for the selection of experts for the new Performance Review Board of the Single European Sky
column3: The recently adopted Regulation (EU) 2024/2803 on the implementation of the Single European Sky establishes a new Performance Review Board comprising seven members, including a chair, for which applications are now open.

column2: Recommendations for Member States to help tackle transport poverty and promote fair, sustainable mobility
column3: The Commission adopted a recommendation which proposes several measures to tackle the complex challenges of transport poverty across the EU.

column2: The Commission welcomes provisional agreement on new European Maritime Safety Agency mandate
column3: The Commission welcomes the provisional political agreement reached today between the Parliament and the Council to update the EMSA mandate.

column2: Vacancy for Assistants (establishment of a reserve list) (Contract Agent– FGIII) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
column3: The deadline for applications is 05 June 2025 12:00 (Central European Time/ Brussels time)

column2: Commission and EU rail sector launch Women in Rail Award 2025
column3: Apply before 17 June 2025!

column2: Deadline extended: Call for expressions of interest – Board of Appeal (European Union Agency for Railways)
column3: The deadline to submit an expression of interest is extended to 30 May 2025.

column2: Commission launches call for evidence on Air Services Regulation revision
column3: The Commission has launched a call for evidence to gather input from stakeholders on the upcoming revision of the Air Services Regulation

column2: May infringements package: key decisions
column3: May infringements package: key decisions

column2: Promoting competitive and attractive rail services: Commission adopts Guidelines on setting up charges for the use of railway infrastructure
column3: The European Commission today adopted Interpretative Guidelines on the setting up of charges for the use of railway infrastructure (‘track access charges’).

column2: Unbalanced tourism: which European destinations are potentially vulnerable?
column3: New insights from the EU tourism dashboard on unbalanced tourism

column2: Call for applications for the selection of experts for the new Performance Review Board of the Single European Sky
column3: The recently adopted Regulation on the implementation of the Single European Sky establishes a new Performance Review Board (PRB) comprising seven members, including a chair, for which applications are now open.

column2: Updated rules for safer roads, less air pollution and digital vehicle documents
column3: For better road safety and air quality across the EU, the Commission is proposing a comprehensive overhaul of the EU’s road safety and vehicle registration rules.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – March 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Europe for Aviation Joins Forces at Airspace World 2025
column3: Joining forces to make Europe the most efficient and environmentally friendly sky to fly in the world!

column2: Commission adopts decision on Schiphol Airport noise reduction plan
column3: Today, the Commission adopted a decision regarding measures to be introduced by the Netherlands at Schiphol Airport to reduce the aircraft noise burden on residents.

column2: Commission boosts European automotive industry's global competitiveness
column3: The European automotive sector is at critical turning point, challenged by rapid technological changes and increasing competition. To address the changes ahead, President von der Leyen in January launched a Strategic Dialogue on the Future of the European Automotive Industry.

column2: European Capital of Smart Tourism and European Green Pioneer of Smart Tourism 2026: applications open tomorrow
column3: Tourism destinations across Europe are invited to submit their innovative practices of smart and sustainable tourism to become leading examples in European tourism.

column2: Commission welcomes ICAO agreement on new aircraft standards for fuel efficiency and noise levels driving sustainability in aviation
column3: The Commission welcomes the landmark decision at the ICAOs Committee for Aviation Environmental Protection (CAEP), agreeing on a comprehensive set of new standards for fuel efficiency and noise levels for new aircraft applicable as of 2029.

column2: Commission brings clarity on ReFuelEU Aviation implementation
column3: The Commission published a report assessing developments in the EU sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) market and evaluating possible improvements to the SAF flexibility mechanism.

column2: Commissioner Tzitzikostas hosts Strategic Dialogue roundtable with European automotive leaders
column3: Commissioner Tzitzikostas hosts Strategic Dialogue roundtable with European automotive leaders

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – January 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: New proposal to strengthen the EU Mandatory Ship Reporting Systems
column3: The Commission has adopted a crucial measure to enhance maritime safety and environmental protection within EU waters.

column2: European Commission champions global road safety at the Global Ministerial Conference in Morocco
column3: As a global advocate for safer roads, the European Commission is committed to driving evidence-based policymaking and supporting initiatives that reduce road casualties worldwide.

column2: Expert Group on Urban Mobility presents work to advance sustainable urban mobility
column3: The Commission’s Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has successfully fulfilled the objectives outlined in its Work Programme 2023-2024 by delivering the last set of insightful reports, including recommendations and feedback to policy on a wide range of topics.

column2: February infringements package: key decisions
column3: February infringements package: key decisions

column2: EU mobilises €422 million to support the deployment of alternative fuels infrastructure in road, maritime and air transport
column3: The Commission has selected 39 new projects deploying alternative fuels infrastructure that will receive over €422 million in EU support.

column2: European Maritime Transport Environmental Report 2025 highlights progress made in sustainable maritime transport but challenges still persist
column3: Today, the second edition of the European Maritime Transport Environmental Report was released, providing a comprehensive overview of the environmental impact of Europe's maritime sector within the EU, as well as an assessment of practices to make it more sustainable.

column2: Product Environmental Footprint (PEF) for hotel accommodation services: Stakeholders invited to comment on new draft rules
column3: To support EU hotels to measure and communicate about their sustainability, stakeholders are invited to participate in a consultation to establish new rules for assessing the environmental impact of hotel accommodation services – the Product Environmental Footprint Category Rules (PEFCR).

column2: Aviation: Updated conflict zone advisories for the Middle East region
column3: The Commission and EASA, along with Member States, are closely monitoring the situation in the Middle East to assess the evolving threats and risks, and their impact on civil aviation.

column2: CEF Transport: €9.5 billion requested for infrastructure projects on the trans-European transport network
column3: CINEA received 258 applications requesting over €9.5 billion in co-funding from the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Transport by the call deadline of 21 January 2025. It is nearly four times more than the €2.5 billion budget available for the 2024 CEF Transport calls for proposals.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – December 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Road transport: EU and Ukraine sign decision to extend smart tachograph to Ukrainian hauliers
column3: On 17 January 2025, the EU and Ukraine agreed on the recognition of smart tachographs for the enforcement of the EU-Ukraine Road Transport Agreement.

column2: With EU support, Ukrainian Railways opens modernised train inspection point on the border with Poland
column3: Ukrzaliznytsia has completed a project to double the capacity of a train inspection point at the Polish-Ukrainian border. This project has been implemented with the parallel funding of the Connecting Europe Facility and the European Investment Bank.

column2: European Aviation Environmental Report 2025 provides key recommendations for a more sustainable future in aviation
column3: The European Aviation Environmental Report offers recommendations on reducing aviation's impact on climate change, noise and air quality.

column2: New EU rules aiming to decarbonise the maritime sector take effect
column3: More renewable and low-carbon fuels will help reduce carbon emissions and air pollution from the EU maritime sector, following the entry into force of the FuelEU Maritime Regulation as of 1 January 2025.

column2: Towards Paperless Freight Transport: EU takes a step forward with eFTI Regulation implementation
column3: Member States can now begin setting up their IT systems in preparation for paperless freight transport, as the first eFTI Regulation implementing and delegated acts entered into force.

column2: EU Aviation Safety Agency updates safety guidance on Russian Airspace
column3: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) has updated its Conflict Zone Information Bulletin for the airspace of the Russian Federation.

column2: Investments in climate adaptation should be an integral part of the trans-European transport network, study shows
column3: A new study that shows how all transport modes on the TEN-T network will be exposed to significantly more climate extremes in the future.

column2: EU introduces Flight Emissions Label for more informed and sustainable travelling
column3: The Commission adopted a Regulation putting in place a Flight Emissions Label (FEL), which offers a clear and trustworthy methodology for calculating flight emissions.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – November 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column3: New study published on Greening of European sea ports

column3: December infringements package: key decisions

column2: New rules for better cross-border enforcement of traffic laws
column3: The Commission welcomes the European Parliament and Council's final adoption of the Directive to strengthen cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules.

column2: Commission launches plan to accelerate high-speed rail across Europe
column3: The Commission unveiled a comprehensive plan to accelerate the development of high-speed rail across the EU, offering passengers significantly reduced travel times.

column2: Commission unveils the Sustainable Transport Investment Plan: a strategic approach to boost renewable and low-carbon fuels for aviation and waterborne transport
column3: The Commission adopted its communication on the Sustainable Transport Investment Plan (STIP), setting out a pivotal roadmap to rapidly accelerate the energy transition of aviation and waterborne transport sectors.

column2: Vacancy: Director of the permanent secretariat of the Transport Community
column3: The permanent secretariat of the Transport Community is announcing a vacancy call for a full-time position of Director of the permanent secretariat of the Transport Community.

column2: Commission adopts plan to complete Madrid–Lisbon high-speed connection by 2034
column3: The Commission has adopted an implementing decision setting out key milestones and deadlines for completing the high-speed rail connection between Madrid and Lisbon.

column3: The European Commission revealed the finalists for the 2026 European Capital and Green Pioneer of Smart Tourism competitions

column2: Commission welcomes Code of Conduct for reliable online reviews for tourism accommodation
column3: Several stakeholders of the EU tourism ecosystem took an important step to ensure trustworthy and reliable online reviews and ratings of hotels and other types of tourism accommodation, by endorsing the ‘Code of Conduct for Online Ratings and Reviews for Tourism Accommodation’.

column2: Boosting tourism and tradition: new call for proposals to promote handicraft products and support craftsmen
column3: The European Commission is offering a special opportunity through a call for proposals aimed at supporting craftsmen across the EU.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – July 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Stronger and more unified  enforcement of EU rules in international road transport as smart tachograph retrofit phase concludes for heavy-duty vehicles
column3: As of today, all heavy-duty vehicles registered in the EU and operating in Member States other than their Member State of registration must be fitted with a smart tachograph (version 2).

column2: Commission takes step to update air service rules
column3: The European Commission is inviting citizens, travellers and stakeholders to express their views via a public consultation on the revision of the Air Services Regulation – the framework governing access to the EU internal market for aviation, and operations within it.

column2: Commission seeks feedback on EU airport rules
column3: The European Commission has today launched a public consultation to assess the effectiveness of three pieces of EU legislation governing access to and the pricing of services at airports. Citizens, professionals and experts alike are invited to give feedback.
The Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL), based in Brussels is establishing a reserve list for a post of communication and ex-post audit officer (temporary agent, grade AD5)

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – June 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: More online travel agencies commit to refund within 14 days for cancelled flights, following a dialogue with the Commission and consumer authorities
column3: Following a dialogue with the European Commission and the Consumer Protection Cooperation Network of national consumer authorities, Expedia and Lastminute.com have committed to better inform consumers of their rights and ensure they receive ticket refunds within 14 days.

column2: Commission publishes new guidance on sustainable rural mobility and ecotourism
column3: Today the Commission publishes four new guidance documents, developed under the SMARTA-NET Project ‘Sustainable rural mobility in support of ecotourism’.

column2: European Commission adopts 9th report on development of the rail market
column3: The ninth Rail Market Monitoring Report (RMMS) analyses developments in the EU rail market from 2018 to 2022.

column2: Portugal signs concession and first tranche of financing for new Lisbon-Porto high-speed line
column3: Backed by €813 million from the Connecting Europe Facility, the Lisbon-Porto high speed railway will shorten travel time between the two cities from approximately 3 hours to 1 hour 15 minutes, once completed.

column2: Commission launches call for evidence on revision to Rail Passenger Rights
column3: The European Commission is requesting input from citizens and stakeholders on a planned targeted revision of the Rail Passenger Rights Regulation.

column2: Sustainable EU tourism: new communication toolkit available
column3: Ready to make tourism in your destination more sustainable? The Sustainable EU Tourism initiative is here to support you.

column2: Commissioner Tzitzikostas hosts dialogues on cutting transport emissions
column3: Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism, Apostolos Tzitzikostas, will host two dialogues to advance the decarbonisation of EU transport.

column2: July infringements package: key decisions
column3: July infringements package: key decisions

column2: The EU Flight Emissions Label takes a flight forward with first airlines committing to the scheme
column3: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) has signed an agreement with Air France-KLM to help the airlines prepare for joining the EU Flight Emissions Label (FEL).

column2: Commission adopts milestones for the completion of Rail Baltica
column3: The European Commission has today adopted an implementing decision setting out key milestones and deadlines for the completion of Rail Baltica, a flagship cross-border railway infrastructure project that will significantly enhance connectivity within the European Union.

column2: Call for applications for the Commission expert group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky
column3: To complement the current memberships of the Commission expert group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky, the Commission has launched a call for applications for new members.

column2: Commission reviews progress toward a Single European Railway Area
column3: The Commission published a report assessing the implementation of the Single European Railway Area Directive, taking an initial position on how its provisions have influenced the development of the European rail sector to date.

column2: EU invests €2.8 billion in 94 transport projects to boost sustainable and connected mobility across Europe
column3: The Commission has selected 94 transport projects to receive nearly €2.8 billion in EU grants under the Connecting Europe Facility.

column2: The Commission sets course for the future of the EU Ports and Maritime Industry
column3: The European Commission has started preparations for an EU Ports Strategy and EU Industrial Maritime Strategy and is inviting stakeholders to participate in the process.

column2: Commissioners Tzitzikostas and Kubilius to discuss necessary investments in EU military mobility and infrastructure
column3: Commissioners Apostolos Tzitzikostas and Andrius Kubilius participate in the extraordinary TEN-T Committee with Member States, aimed at speeding up the EU’s military mobility policy -a cornerstone of Europe's defence and security architecture.

column2: Commission proposes toll exemptions to boost demand for zero-emission lorries and buses
column3: As pledged in its Industrial Action Plan for the European automotive sector, the Commission is proposing to extend the period in which zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles (HDVs) can be exempted from tolls and user charges.

column2: The Commission welcomes provisional agreement on modernising river information services in EU
column3: The Commission welcomes the provisional political agreement to modernise traffic management on the EU’s rivers and canals.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – May 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – April 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Deadline extended: Call for applications for the selection of experts for the new Performance Review Board of the Single European Sky
column3: The recently adopted Regulation (EU) 2024/2803 on the implementation of the Single European Sky establishes a new Performance Review Board comprising seven members, including a chair, for which applications are now open.

column2: Recommendations for Member States to help tackle transport poverty and promote fair, sustainable mobility
column3: The Commission adopted a recommendation which proposes several measures to tackle the complex challenges of transport poverty across the EU.

column2: The Commission welcomes provisional agreement on new European Maritime Safety Agency mandate
column3: The Commission welcomes the provisional political agreement reached today between the Parliament and the Council to update the EMSA mandate.

column2: Vacancy for Assistants (establishment of a reserve list) (Contract Agent– FGIII) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
column3: The deadline for applications is 05 June 2025 12:00 (Central European Time/ Brussels time)

column2: Commission and EU rail sector launch Women in Rail Award 2025
column3: Apply before 17 June 2025!

column2: Deadline extended: Call for expressions of interest – Board of Appeal (European Union Agency for Railways)
column3: The deadline to submit an expression of interest is extended to 30 May 2025.

column2: Commission launches call for evidence on Air Services Regulation revision
column3: The Commission has launched a call for evidence to gather input from stakeholders on the upcoming revision of the Air Services Regulation

column2: May infringements package: key decisions
column3: May infringements package: key decisions

column2: Promoting competitive and attractive rail services: Commission adopts Guidelines on setting up charges for the use of railway infrastructure
column3: The European Commission today adopted Interpretative Guidelines on the setting up of charges for the use of railway infrastructure (‘track access charges’).

column2: Unbalanced tourism: which European destinations are potentially vulnerable?
column3: New insights from the EU tourism dashboard on unbalanced tourism

column2: Call for applications for the selection of experts for the new Performance Review Board of the Single European Sky
column3: The recently adopted Regulation on the implementation of the Single European Sky establishes a new Performance Review Board (PRB) comprising seven members, including a chair, for which applications are now open.

column2: Updated rules for safer roads, less air pollution and digital vehicle documents
column3: For better road safety and air quality across the EU, the Commission is proposing a comprehensive overhaul of the EU’s road safety and vehicle registration rules.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – March 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Commission strengthens the EU Mandatory Ship Reporting Systems
column3: The Commission has adopted a crucial measure to enhance maritime safety and environmental protection around the EU’s coasts.

column2: Selection procedure of European TEN-T Coordinators
column3: The Commission is launching the procedure for the selection of European TEN-T coordinators for three European Transport Corridors

column2: Commissioner Tzitzikostas hosts implementation dialogue on high-speed rail
column3: Today’s implementation dialogue on high-speed rail, hosted by Commissioner Tzitzikostas, will focus on improving EU rail connectivity.

column2: Commission enhances interoperability and transparency of alternative fuels infrastructure data
column3: The Commission has adopted a new Implementing Regulation to support the uniform and effective provision of compatible, interoperable and real-time alternative fuels infrastructure data, further advancing the goals set out in the Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR)

column2: Landmark agreement towards achieving net-zero emissions from global shipping by 2050
column3: The Commission welcomes today’s landmark agreement at the International Maritime Organization (IMO), to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions from global shipping ‘by or around 2050’.

column2: More safe and secure parking for professional drivers is needed, EU study reveals
column3: According to a new European Commission study, the EU is facing a critical shortage of Safe and Secure Parking Areas (SSPAs) for professional drivers, with a current gap of 390,057 parking spaces that is expected to grow to 483,000 by 2040.

column2: The EU and Singapore continue deepening relations at 8th EU-Singapore Transport Dialogue
column3: At the 8th EU-Singapore Transport Dialogue, discussions revolved around bilateral technical cooperation across all transport modes and the global challenges to international transport.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – February 2025
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: EU road fatalities drop by 3% in 2024, but progress remains slow
column3: The Commission released preliminary figures on road fatalities for 2024, reporting around 19,800 deaths - a 3% decrease from 2023, equivalent to 600 fewer lives lost.

column2: March infringements package: key decisions
column3: March infringements package: key decisions

column2: Europe for Aviation Joins Forces at Airspace World 2025
column3: Joining forces to make Europe the most efficient and environmentally friendly sky to fly in the world!

column2: Commission adopts decision on Schiphol Airport noise reduction plan
column3: Today, the Commission adopted a decision regarding measures to be introduced by the Netherlands at Schiphol Airport to reduce the aircraft noise burden on residents.

column2: Commission boosts European automotive industry's global competitiveness
column3: The European automotive sector is at critical turning point, challenged by rapid technological changes and increasing competition. To address the changes ahead, President von der Leyen in January launched a Strategic Dialogue on the Future of the European Automotive Industry.

column2: European Capital of Smart Tourism and European Green Pioneer of Smart Tourism 2026: applications open tomorrow
column3: Tourism destinations across Europe are invited to submit their innovative practices of smart and sustainable tourism to become leading examples in European tourism.

column2: Commission welcomes ICAO agreement on new aircraft standards for fuel efficiency and noise levels driving sustainability in aviation
column3: The Commission welcomes the landmark decision at the ICAOs Committee for Aviation Environmental Protection (CAEP), agreeing on a comprehensive set of new standards for fuel efficiency and noise levels for new aircraft applicable as of 2029.

column2: Commission brings clarity on ReFuelEU Aviation implementation
column3: The Commission published a report assessing developments in the EU sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) market and evaluating possible improvements to the SAF flexibility mechanism.

column2: CEF Transport: €9.5 billion requested for infrastructure projects on the trans-European transport network
column3: CINEA received 258 applications requesting over €9.5 billion in co-funding from the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Transport by the call deadline of 21 January 2025. It is nearly four times more than the €2.5 billion budget available for the 2024 CEF Transport calls for proposals.

column2: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – December 2024
column3: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

column2: Road transport: EU and Ukraine sign decision to extend smart tachograph to Ukrainian hauliers
column3: On 17 January 2025, the EU and Ukraine agreed on the recognition of smart tachographs for the enforcement of the EU-Ukraine Road Transport Agreement.

column2: With EU support, Ukrainian Railways opens modernised train inspection point on the border with Poland
column3: Ukrzaliznytsia has completed a project to double the capacity of a train inspection point at the Polish-Ukrainian border. This project has been implemented with the parallel funding of the Connecting Europe Facility and the European Investment Bank.

column2: European Aviation Environmental Report 2025 provides key recommendations for a more sustainable future in aviation
column3: The European Aviation Environmental Report offers recommendations on reducing aviation's impact on climate change, noise and air quality.

column2: New EU rules aiming to decarbonise the maritime sector take effect
column3: More renewable and low-carbon fuels will help reduce carbon emissions and air pollution from the EU maritime sector, following the entry into force of the FuelEU Maritime Regulation as of 1 January 2025.

column2: Towards Paperless Freight Transport: EU takes a step forward with eFTI Regulation implementation
column3: Member States can now begin setting up their IT systems in preparation for paperless freight transport, as the first eFTI Regulation implementing and delegated acts entered into force.

column2: EU Aviation Safety Agency updates safety guidance on Russian Airspace
column3: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) has updated its Conflict Zone Information Bulletin for the airspace of the Russian Federation.

column2: Investments in climate adaptation should be an integral part of the trans-European transport network, study shows
column3: A new study that shows how all transport modes on the TEN-T network will be exposed to significantly more climate extremes in the future.

column2: EU introduces Flight Emissions Label for more informed and sustainable travelling
column3: The Commission adopted a Regulation putting in place a Flight Emissions Label (FEL), which offers a clear and trustworthy methodology for calculating flight emissions.
